abstract.text: Measurements of double helicity asymmetries in inclusive hadron production in polarized p + p collisions are sensitive to helicity-dependent parton distribution functions, in particular to the gluon helicity distribution, ∆g.
This study focuses on the extraction of the double helicity asymmetry in η production ( p + p → η + X), the η cross section and the η/π 0 cross section ratio.
The cross section and ratio measurements provide essential input for the extraction of fragmentation functions that are needed to access the helicity-dependent parton distribution functions.

body_text.text: Two data sets have been analyzed, collected by requiring two different trigger selections.
body_text.section: II. EXTRACTION OF η AND π 0 YIELDS

body_text.text: The minimum bias (MB) trigger requires coincident signals in two beam-beam counters (BBCs) [13], which are arrays of quartz-radiatoř Cerenkov counters providing full azimuthal coverage at pseudorapidities of 3.0 < |η| < 3.9.
body_text.section: II. EXTRACTION OF η AND π 0 YIELDS

body_text.text: Based on the timing of the signals from the two BBCs, the event vertex is reconstructed and required to be within 30 cm of the nominal interaction point.
body_text.section: II. EXTRACTION OF η AND π 0 YIELDS

body_text.text: In addition to the MB trigger, the high-p T triggered data set requires an energy deposition larger than approximately 1.4 GeV in an area of 4 × 4 towers in the electromagnetic calorimeter (EMCal) [14].
body_text.section: II. EXTRACTION OF η AND π 0 YIELDS

body_text.text: The EMCal is the primary detector used in this analysis, located at a radial distance of about 5 m from the beam pipe.
body_text.section: II. EXTRACTION OF η AND π 0 YIELDS

body_text.text: It covers the pseudo-rapidity range |η| < 0.35 and has an azimuthal acceptance of ∆φ = π.
body_text.section: II. EXTRACTION OF η AND π 0 YIELDS

body_text.text: The EMCal comprises eight sectors, six of which are composed of a total of 15552 lead-scintillator (PbSc) sandwich towers (5.5 cm x 5.5 cm x 37.5 cm), and two sectors of lead-glass (PbGl)Čerenkov calorimeters, consisting of a total of 9216 towers (4 cm x 4 cm x 40 cm).
body_text.section: II. EXTRACTION OF η AND π 0 YIELDS

body_text.text: For the cross section measurements only the PbSc was used.

body_text.text: V. SUMMARY
The double helicity asymmetry in η production is measured and found to be consistent with zero in the transverse momentum range between 2 GeV/c and 9 GeV/c.
body_text.section: V. SUMMARY

body_text.text: The η cross section is determined over seven orders of magnitude between 2 GeV/c and 20 GeV/c in transverse momentum.
body_text.section: V. SUMMARY

body_text.text: In particular due to the wide range in transverse momentum these data serve as important input for the extraction of fragmentation functions.
body_text.section: V. SUMMARY

body_text.text: The η to π 0 cross section ratio as a function of p T has been extracted in a single pass over the same data set, thus minimizing systematic uncertainties.
body_text.section: V. SUMMARY

body_text.text: A fit to a constant above p T = 2 GeV/c or p T = 3 GeV/c yields a value of R η/π 0 = 0.51 ± 0.01 stat ± 0.01 syst .
body_text.section: V. SUMMARY

body_text.text: The inclusion of these data on the ratio in future fragmentation function extractions should allow for more precise results for both particle species.
body_text.section: V. SUMMARY

body_text.text: This opens up the possibility to include the data on the double helicity asymmetry in future NLO pQCD fits in order to further constrain the polarized parton distribution functions, in particular the helicity-dependent gluon distribution function.
body_text.section: V. SUMMARY
